sn35.151:1.1: “Mendicants, this spiritual life is lived without a resident pupil and without a teaching master.
sn35.151:1.2: A mendicant who lives with a resident pupil and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.
sn35.151:1.3: A mendicant who lives without a resident pupil and a teaching master lives in happiness and comfort.
sn35.151:1.4: And how does a mendicant who lives with a resident pupil and a teaching master live in suffering and discomfort?
sn35.151:1.5: When a mendicant sees a sight with the eye, bad, unskillful phenomena arise: memories and thoughts that tighten fetters.
sn35.151:1.6: Those qualities reside within. Since they have bad unskillful qualities residing within,
sn35.151:1.7: they’re said to have a resident pupil.
sn35.151:1.8: Those qualities master them. Since they’re mastered by bad unskillful qualities,
sn35.151:1.9: they’re said to have a teaching master.
sn35.151:2.1: Furthermore, when a mendicant hears … smells … tastes … touches …
sn35.151:3.1: knows an idea with the mind, bad, unskillful phenomena arise: memories and thoughts that tighten fetters.
sn35.151:3.2: Those qualities reside within. Since they have bad unskillful qualities residing within,
sn35.151:3.3: they’re said to have a resident pupil.
sn35.151:3.4: Those qualities master them. Since they’re mastered by bad unskillful qualities,
sn35.151:3.5: they’re said to have a teaching master.
sn35.151:3.6: That’s how a mendicant who lives with a resident pupil and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.
sn35.151:4.1: And how does a mendicant who lives without a resident pupil and a teaching master live in happiness and comfort?
sn35.151:4.2: When a mendicant sees a sight with the eye, bad, unskillful phenomena don’t arise: memories and thoughts that tighten fetters.
sn35.151:4.3: Those qualities don’t reside within. Since they don’t have bad unskillful qualities residing within,
sn35.151:4.4: they’re said to not have a resident pupil.
sn35.151:4.5: Those qualities don’t master them. Since they’re not mastered by bad unskillful qualities,
sn35.151:4.6: they’re said to not have a teaching master.
sn35.151:5.1: Furthermore, when a mendicant hears … smells … tastes … touches …
sn35.151:6.1: knows an idea with the mind, bad, unskillful phenomena don’t arise: memories and thoughts that tighten fetters.
sn35.151:6.2: Those qualities don’t reside within. Since they don’t have bad unskillful qualities residing within,
sn35.151:6.3: they’re said to not have a resident pupil.
sn35.151:6.4: Those qualities don’t master them. Since they’re not mastered by bad unskillful qualities,
sn35.151:6.5: they’re said to not have a teaching master.
sn35.151:6.6: That’s how a mendicant who lives without a resident pupil and a teaching master lives in happiness and comfort.
sn35.151:6.7: This spiritual life is lived without a resident pupil and without a teaching master.
sn35.151:6.8: A mendicant who lives with a resident pupil and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.
sn35.151:6.9: A mendicant who lives without a resident pupil and a teaching master lives in happiness and comfort.”
